OOC:

Add BW to that two just remembered the "cloning" megatron/tarantulous=
 did...but then again what megatron originally cloned was just dinobots "al=
ternate form", the clone could not transform and was pretty worthless ;)

 =
 ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Jonathan 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.c=
om 
  Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 5:54 PM
  Subject: Re: All Read: Im=
portant


  OOC:

  Transformers don't have DNA... they use DNA scans to se=
lect an alternate form but beyond that they're still technological life for=
ms....wasn't til BM that this fact was bastardized.

    ----- Original Mes=
sage ----- 
    From: Jeepers Creepers 
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com

 Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 5:39 PM

      ----- Original Me=
ssage -----

nt: Wednesday, January 30, 2002 12:25 PM

      i got an idea once a char is killed they dont come back 

    =
    Jonathan <jhogan@...> wrote: 

        Anyway I was going=
 to rant on about how a sequel wouldn't be all that
        different from =
a restart but I figured why bother?

        When I hit the end of my long =
typed out rant I hit the problem. The real
        one. Another person post=
ed that characters are not allowed to die
        currently...he is utterly=
 incorrect.

        The problem is the role-playing 101 aspect. People are=
 given the
        responsibility to judge how much damage they take...howe=
ver as we've seen
        some can't role-play their way out of a wet paper=
 bag let alone responsibly
        judge how much damage their character ta=
kes. When a bot does get damaged
        what typically happens here?

    =
    Here's the list:

        1) The enemy bot suddenly becomes cockeyed un=
able to hit the broad side of a
        barn even if he was a g1 and standi=
ng over it.

        2) The bot never gives chase to his prey. It always le=
ts the long time
        character slip away.

        3) A short stay (a f=
ew hours usually) in the CR chamber and any damage is
        completely go=
ne.

        4) The character "dies" but faked his death coming back as an =
enemy
        infiltrator.

        5) Character "dies" but an evil clone a=
ppears which after various meeting
        with colleagues or "loved ones" =
turns good again. Personality reverts to
        pre-evil clone.

        6=
) Character "dies" but is reborn as a more powerful offspring. Personality
=
        is hardly different.

        7) Character "dies" but the players 6=
 other characters cart it's blasted
        carcass back to a lab where the=
y resurrect him.

        8) Character "dies" replace with new bot same per=
sonality...eventually
        people will forget you died and you can go ba=
ck to your old form.

        Since most will never let their "favorite" ch=
aracter(s) die, I mean truly
        die, never come back like, there's rea=
lly very little new plotlines you can
        do with them without repeatin=
g rehashed already done ones. Take for example
        the geotrons planing=
 to attack the new cat faction....both factions will
        survive, I dou=
bt either player who controls the majority of bots in either
        factio=
n is gonna let their characters get anywhere near killed.

        And what=
's to stop this from happening if a restart/sequel DOES occur? The
        =
role-playing by some will still stink, characters will still be incapable o=
f
        dying and given another year or so all plotlines for THAT game wi=
ll be
        starting to repeat. While I still do believe a restart/sequel=
 is in order I
        think the role-playing problem needs addressing firs=
t to stop a repeat of
        what's happening to NBW.



        ----- Ori=
